fields.description: We need to have a continuous build system that builds our products all the time.  This will enable us to capture problems before they reach the nightly build.
fields.summary: Improve nightly build - create continuous build system

fields.description: Issue details pane does not stretch properly when reporter name is a long single word
fields.summary: Issue details pane does not stretch properly when reporter name is a long single word

fields.description:
The original estimate field when creating an issue gives a format error if you use a floating point number, e.g. I want to put 1.5d for one and a half days.
The description seems to imply that you can do this: 

"The format of this is ' *w *d *h *m ' (representing weeks, days, hours and minutes - where * can be any number)"
fields.summary: original estimate field description suggests any number can be entered

fields.description:
On http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/quicksearch.html:
If you type in the key of an issue, you will jump straight to that issue. You do need to use the correct case, as JIRA will translate your search into the correct case. For example, if you type in 'abc-107', you will get redirected to the JIRA issue 'ABC-107'.
should be "You do not need to use the correct case"

On http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/dashboard.htm:
The "Add new portlet" link in the top-right corner of the dashboard can be used to add a porlet to the dashboard page. 
should be portlet, not porlet
fields.summary: documentation typos

fields.description: Look at  open issues tab for project JIRA. For 3.2 there are shown 44 open Issues. When you klick on this version, Issue navigator shows 39 issues. Roadmap for this version shows  "96 of 135 issues have been resolved". Pretty sure that I've seen this before with 3.2beta

fields.description: Currently indexing loads all the issues into memory, we need to index in constant memory instead.
fields.summary: Improve indexing to run in constant memory
Make sure assigning stops progress forall operations

fields.description: Issue Creation from Email does not work for mail from lists, specifically the ActiveMQ lists.  If I send an email from my own personal account, it works fine.
fields.summary: Issue Creation from Email does not work for mail from lists

fields.description: It would be helpful to be able to filter on issues that do not yet have a due date (or other custom date field) specified.  This could be achived (via a pseudo-hack) ) if there were some sort of boolean filtering (e.g. all issues NOT due before 1/1/2200)
fields.summary: Allow filtering for when dates are missing

fields.description:
In the [Create Custom Field: Custom field details (Step 2 of 2) ] screen

in the [Choose applicable context] section look at the description 

" Please choose the contexts where this configuration will be applicable. Note that this will apply to only issues with the selected isssue type as above. If this is too restrictive, please use the advanced mode."


Please note that "issue" is spelled "Isssue" in the second occurence of the word in this sentence.

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm planning to build a JAVA Swing based client on a Jira installation for a workflow system. Therefor I need to use things like

doAction
getAvailable Actions
getCurrentSteps

and so on.
They are available in the OSWorkflow API and I wonder whether  I can use them from a JIRA installation via the SOAP interface.

This might possibly be a total dump question but thats because I'm quite new to JIRA. Maybe I missed something while searching for ressources on that topic.
fields.summary: Using Workflow Actions over SOAP interface

fields.description: I've been running fine from day 1 and today email will no longer be sent automatically - I have to flush the mail queue manually. I've tried editing the service's number of minutes and restarted JIRA and its server 3 times. All to no avail. The messages will not be delivered. This is critical for us since everyone has learned to depend on email notifications.
fields.summary: email will not get sent from queue

fields.description:
This was our first time trying to use filters.. I created and shared a filter and showed a user how he could subscribe to it. And he did. Then I had to recreate the filter so I deleted it (JIRA told me there were no subscriptions). And I recreated the filter with the same name as the previous filter. Then I had the user subscribe to this new filter. Although I wonder which filter it thinks he was subscribed to - the original or the second one. Anyway, I then decided to set up a subscription for a whole group to this filter, and this user is also a member of that group. So, on his screen he sees the original subscription, and I told him to delete the old (personal) one. However when he does, he gets this error (below). Notice the URL refers to filterid 10141 which is in factthe ID of the correct new filter. So I'm not sure if all that preamble was relevant or not. In my XML Backup from last night you can see the subscriptions: Note that filterID 101040 no longer exists, and although I don't have an XML output for today yet, there will be additional subscriptions for filter 10141 for the group. I'll add that as a comment to the issue when I get it. By the way - is there documentation on how to customize the e-mail (and which fields display) in the notification filter? I am sending out 'unassigned' issues, so having a column for "Assign To" doesn't make much sense. System Error A system error has occurred. If this problem persists - please notify your JIRA administrator of this problem. If you are an administrator, please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page. Else, please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information: a description of your problem cut & paste the error and system information found below attach the application server log file Cause: Referer URL: http://issues.webfeat.com/secure/ViewSubscriptions.jspa?filterId=10141 Build Information: Uptime: N/A Edition: Enterprise Version: 3.0.3 Build Number: 75 Server Information: Application Server: Apache Tomcat/4.1.29 Servlet Version: 2.3 Memory Information: Total Memory: 381 MB Free Memory: 245 MB Used Memory: 136 MB System Information: System Date: Wednesday, 18 May 2005 System Time: 11:35:51 Java Version: 1.5.0_01 Java Vendor: Sun Microsystems Inc. fields.description:
There is a service to get issue types, but this is calling ConstantManager#getIssueTypes which only returns regular issue types.  It would be nice if this service were either updated to call #getAllIssueTypes or a new service added to get sub-task issue types.  I don't have a particular preference for either implementation.

I am writing an eclipse plugin and need the info to display an appropriate image and description for issues with a type of sub-task.  I don't have a copy of Jira, so I don't have any patches for you :(
fields.summary: Unable to get sub-task issue types though RPC interface

fields.description:
I had many emails showing up in the error queue. After fixing the mail server problem I resent all email. 

The mail queue page is incomplete, the date or time is missing. The text reads:

The queue currently has 5 items in it.

The mail queue is sending, it started sending at .
fields.summary: date/time missing in mail queue page

fields.description:
If I have a workflow state defined as:

    <step id="7" name="Closed">
      <meta name="jira.issue.editable">false</meta>
      <meta name="jira.status.id">6</meta>
    </step>       

then JIRA issues in this state do not have an OS_CURRENTSTEP record (as there are no outgoing transitions), and the Integrity Checker marks such issues as invalid.
fields.summary: Integrity checker marks issues in transitionless steps as invalid

fields.description: Update the JIRA Development Kit to match JIRA 3.2
fields.summary: Update the JIRA Development Kit to match JIRA 3.2

fields.description: In an active workflow, the initial transition to create an issue is not visible. You need to click edit, then select a transition, and then navigate back through the transitions to the 'Create' transition to see what is happening there.
fields.summary: Cannot browse the initial 'Create' transition in active workflows

fields.description: Occasionally the JIRA admin links (particularly 'Show all') fail to work in JIRA 3.2.  Reloading the page sometimes fixes this. It looks like we have bugs in the Javascript logic.
fields.summary: Admin menu links intermittently fail to work
NNTP plugin should show more descriptive subject for Resolved posts

fields.description:
I created two issues in a project in our instance of Jira. In the description, I included a link to one of our pages in our instance of Confluence. The trackback was created successfully on the Confluence page. Later, I moved the two issues to another project in Jira. I visited the Confluence page recently and noticed that the trackbacks were still linking to the original issue number. When clicking on the trackback, Jira returns the error: "ERROR: The issue you are trying to view does not exist. "

I did look at the history of both issues to verify that the issue numbers that the Confluence page point to are in fact the very issues that I moved. If it has not already been addressed, I think that Jira should update all applicable Confluence trackbacks when an operation is being performed on the issue such that the issue key changes. At the very least, when the issue key changes, Jira ought to send a new trackback to Confluence.
fields.summary: Resend trackbacks when issues are moved

fields.description: A user of my JIRA installation was looking to be able to search issues having votes.  The two work arounds I presented were to view the Popular Issues for the project in question, or to use a filter and add Votes to the Issue Navigator and sort.  That being said, it would still be nice to be able to create a filter for issues that had, for example, greater than 2 votes.
fields.summary: Allow filtering by number of votes

fields.description:
Hi,
after downgrading Jira from Enterprise Version to Professional  I've got the following problem:
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.get] "summary" is not a field of Issue

I followed the online documentation step by step and everything worked fine, so far.

Hope you can help me.

Best regards

Jörg Plümacher
fields.summary: Problems after downgrading jira

fields.description:
The priority field is missing in the "Find Issue" fields list on the left column, there is no way to save a filter with priority field. 

On the browse project page, there is no display on the right column for the priority statistics. Although it's possible to add a portlet with priority statistics in the dashboard.
fields.summary: The priority field is missing in the "Find Issue" fields list on the left column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6712].
  {panel}

Adding a comment only on the originating issue when linking issues

It might just be me, but I get really cobnfused when I see comments that are created from when people create links. It seems that they appear in both the issue the link is being created from and the target issue. This means that comments that makes sense on the original issue sometimes can be very confusing in the target issue. 

eg. JRA 8326 and JRA-4619

We should be able to at least choose to not add the comment for the target issue. I would be tempted to turn it off really
fields.summary: Adding a comment only on the originating issue when linking issues

fields.description: We use the Pop service to create new issues andtherefore we ahve set the "Only Reporter" Issue Security Level as default value for new isues, but in the beta 3.2 the issues will not get the default issue security level they have no security level. This is aabsolute blocker for us, because now everybody can see every issue. We will go back to 3.1.1 because there it was working fine. :-(
fields.summary: Creating Issue with Pop Service ignore default Issue Security Level

fields.description:
Select groups/users for issue level security at issue creation time

Currently, users will have to create a new Security Level for each group / user. Many people seems have this problem, especially those who uses groups to categorize clients etc.

It would be great to have a "Dynamic Group" security level or some such that would allow users to input the group that this issue can be visible to.
fields.summary: Select groups/users for issue level security at issue creation time

fields.description:
If the 'Affects Version' is required and the version has been archived, editing the issue will cause errors.  The Affected version, because it is archived, does not show up in the dropdown list, so the page thinks that no version has been selected when it is required.

The currently set Affects version (and presumably fix for version) should be included in the drop down list, even when archived.

fields.description:
Hello,

I've been able to customize the entries available in a list shown in the portlet edit form by creating a class that implements com.atlassian.configurable.ValuesGenerator, and then specifying that class in the atlassian-plugin.xml, like this:

...                
<type>select</type>
<values class="com.test.CustomFieldValueGenerator"/>
...

But I'd need to go further: I'd like to control which entries a user can select in that list, depending in the values of other fields in the form. I mean, I've seen that there is a control system that doesn't allow a user to enter something different from a number in a text field that is defined as being of type "long" in the atlassian-plugin.xml. What I'd like to do is to dinamically change the contents of a list based on the selection of another list.

Is there any way of extending the portlet edit form to do so?


TIA,
David

fields.description:
Many websites use XSL to style RSS output, creating a nice XHTML output. This helps to not scare away new users, and provide information on how to use the feed, links to a few aggregators, etc.

I think Jira would benefit from styling its XML issue view. To most of our users, the XML link on the search page appears useless, spurting out some programming language. A heading describing the content and how it might be used would help users discover the benefits of the various RSS technologies.
fields.summary: Provide stylesheet for RSS search results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6682].
  {panel}

Currently, you have two options: 
1) poll cvs
2) manually refresh....

What would be nice would be to provide for a URL-based triggering of the CVS changelog retrieval.
You want a simple url you can simply do a http get (wget) - which can be called by a CVS commit script (ala CVSspam).

For security purposes, you might want to limit the http calls to the server specified in the cvsroot.
It cant require any credentials - otherwise you would have to put them in cleartext in the commit script...

You might also want to expose it via SOAP.
That way we can register a plugin in Fisheye (which is already detecting CVS changes) to call into Jira on cvs commit...

Our CVS server is quite a powerful machine - but it is getting hammerred enough by Cruise Control instances polling - it doesnt need more polling from Jira ;-)
fields.summary: Have a "triggered" mode rather than poll CVS repository.

fields.description:
Sue wrote:
> Nick,
> 
> Our mappings are identical to yours below.
> 
> we are not storing unicode, I just created the workflows with the JIRA administration function in the workflows screen.  I think datalength() returns a byte count.
> 
> the dba said we cant increase the size of a text field, and we tested the textsize that is being used by JIRA when data is inserted into that table.   the textsize is 2147483647 so its not the textsize.  are you using INSERT or WRITETEXT to get the data in?  
> 
> Do we know if anyone else has had this problem with long workflows on a sybase or other database?
> 
> Also interestingly the long workflow will work to completion on created issues and seem fine, then when a new workflow is added or one deleted the error will occur and the data is truncated.
> 
> Regards,
> Sue.
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nick Menere [mailto:nick.menere@atlassian.com]
> Cc: support@atlassian.com
> Subject: Re: Corrupted custom workflows
> 
> 
> Sue,
> To our knowledge we do not change the data size of any of these rows and 
> we don't believe the libraries we use do either.
> By any chance are you storing unicode characters?  These take up 2 bytes 
> instead of 1.  Hence 16K characters would take up 32K bytes.  Though I 
> am not sure whether datalength() returns a byte count or a character count.
> 
> Just to give you a bit background as to how we set up our data types.
> 
> In the file - entitymodel.xml we define our mappings from java objects 
> to tables.  In here you will find a mapping for workflows.
> It looks like this:
>      <entity entity-name="Workflow" table-name="jiraworkflows" 
> package-name="">
>          <field name="id" type="numeric"/>
> 
>          <field name="name" col-name="workflowname" type="long-varchar"/>
>          <field name="creator" col-name="creatorname" type="long-varchar"/>
>          <field name="descriptor" type="extremely-long"/>
>          <field name="islocked" type="short-varchar"/>
> 
>          <prim-key field="id"/>
>      </entity>
> 
> As you can see the descriptor column is mapped to be of type 
> "extremely-long"
> 
> This value is then mapped to a value in the file fieldtype-sybase.xml
> This value should be:
> <field-type-def type="extremely-long" sql-type="TEXT" 
> java-type="String"></field-type-def>
> 
> Can you check that yours are mapped correctly.
> Is it possible for you dba to increase the size of these columns - e.g. 
> make them 64K?
> I have asked around my colleagues and google and can't find anything on 
> our side that would cause this.
> 
> Cheers,
> Nick
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Sue wrote:
> 
>>Nick, 
>>
>>This is what our DBA said about my problem.  Any idea where JIRA is setting this textsize?.... Sue.
>>
>>the default maximum TEXT size in Sybase is 32K (select @@textsize).
>>
>>you can modify this by using (for example, in bytes).....
>>
>>	set textsize 1000000
>>
>>..... before inserting data into the TEXT column.
>>
>>it looks like your program is already modifying it to be a max of 16Kb... eg:
>>
>>1> select datalength(DESCRIPTOR) from jiraworkflows
>>2> go
>>             
>> ----------- 
>>       12813 
>>       12813 
>>       16384 
>>       16384 
>>       16384 
>>       16384 
>>       16384 
>>       16384 
>>
>>(8 rows affected)
>>1> 
>>
>>you just need to find where in the code this can (or rather does) occur, and then make it much larger.
>>
>>
>>Shane
>>
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: Nick Menere [mailto:nick.menere@atlassian.com]
>>Cc: support@atlassian.com
>>Subject: Re: Corrupted custom workflows
>>
>>
>>Sue,
>>this seems most weird.  The text field in Sybase should be able to 
>>handle strings of up to 2 Gig.  As big as your workflow is, I doubt it 
>>is that big!
>>Are you able to determine the length of the strings that have been 
>>truncated?
>>Can you confirm that field can store massive strings?  Maybe manually 
>>inserting a string into this table then checking it and then removing it?
>>
>>If the database is the issue, one way to fix this would be to store the 
>>workflows on disk.  Details on how to do this are located at:
>>http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Store+Workflow+on+Disk
>>
>>Cheers,
>>Nick
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>Sue wrote:
>>
>>
>>>Nick,
>>>
>>>Thanks for getting back to me.  It is a TEXT type and I found the descriptor column values, it is truncating the long workflows.  Does this mean I can only create workflows with under 10 or so steps?  These ones had 15  and would often have more.
>>>
>>>Regards,
>>>Sue.
>>>
>>>-----Original Message-----
>>>From: Nick Menere [mailto:nick.menere@atlassian.com]
>>>Subject: Re: Corrupted custom workflows
>>>
>>>
>>>Hi Sue,
>>>It looks as though the descriptor (stored as xml) may have been  cut short.
>>>
>>>There should be entries in the jiraworkflow table in the descriptor 
>>>column.  Are there no entries for any workflow here?
>>>Was this a large workflow?  Many steps?
>>>One thing you may want to check is the size of this column.  Is it of 
>>>type TEXT and does it allow extremely long strings?
>>>
>>>
>>>Chers,
>>>Nick
>>>
>>>Sue wrote:
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>>Hi,
>>>>
>>>>I am working on the JIRA Enterprise Edition that we have just bought at ...
>>>>
>>>>I created a custom workflow and a day or so later it disappeared.  This >>is the error in the logs when I try to use anything ie. workflow scheme >>that is associated with the workflow.
>>>>
>>>>ole0.bmp
>>>>
>>>>And here is how it appears in the workflow screen, blank with no name. 
>>>>

fields.summary: Typo on Associate field screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6667].
  {panel}

With enough columns shown in a report, Jira has trouble cramming them into the narrow screen width, especially if the filter editor is open on the left side.

Outlook 2003 added a nice way to deal with this exact same problem. They permitted multi-line (visually) rows in their tables. So I'll have "From", the message type, and when it was received on line 1, then on line two I get the whole subject.

Jira would really benefit from this same behavior. Instead of oddly wrapped or truncated summaries that have to fit in with about ten other fields that are important, they could get an entire line to themselves.

I created a couple mockups in Excel. They're not very pretty but I hope they get the idea across!

fields.description:
We are using gnu javamail jar with other applications inside the same tomcat instance and it's causing some problems with JIRA.
We tried to replace the JIRA's javamail-1.2.jar with the gnu implementation but we have got errors indicating that JIRA was relying on internal Sun classes and preventing the replacement of javamail.
I think it should be possible for JIRA to rely only on javamail public API.
fields.summary: Allow the use of gnu javamail instead of Sun

fields.description:
I've seen that there are classes such com.atlassian.jira.portal.ProjectValuesGenerator that implement com.atlassian.configurable.ValuesGenerator, and that are used to provide a list of values when configuring a portlet.

For example, with an entry like this in the atlassian-plugin.xml file:

...
            <property>
                <key>projectid</key>
                <name>tests.name</name>
                <description>tests.description</description>
                <type>select</type>
                <values class="com.atlassian.jira.portal.ProjectValuesGenerator"/>
            </property>
...

My question is: how can I implement my own generator, so that I can use it to create a list of dynamically calculated values that populate a list in the portlet configuration form?

I mean, I'd like to create a class that can be used like this in the atlassian-plugin.xml:

...
            <property>
                <key>projectid</key>
                <name>tests.name</name>
                <description>tests.description</description>
                <type>select</type>
                <values class="com.tests.MyOwnValueGenerator"/>
            </property>
...


TIA
fields.summary: How to create a custom ValueGenerator

fields.description:
I'm not sure if this is issue is with JIRA or with the jTDS classes.

When a custom field of type number is created, the values are saved in instances of the customfieldvalue table in the NUMBERVALUE field. This field has a data type of "numeric". This is a data type intended for floating point numbers that stores the values in numeric formt (rather tha a binary floating point format). It can be defined with values for "precision" (the number of digits) and "scale" (the maximum number of decimal places to the right of the decimal point).

The default values for precision and scale are used (18 and 0 respectively), which effectively means that only integers values can be saved in custom number fields. The value for scale should higher (possibly 18 but I'm not familiar enough with MSSQL to comment).

The workaround is to edit the table design manually using Microsoft Enterprise Manager and set scale to a higher value.
fields.summary: MSSQL data type parameters for custom Number  field values incorrect

fields.description:
In JIRA 3.2 a lot of optimisations have been done to increase JIRAs perfromance. Issues that are retrieved in one query SQL where possible.

Unfortunately, if a lot of issues have to be retreived in one go the database may run out of resources processing this query. This can happen when processing subscriptions as all issues that match the subscription's filter need to be retrieved. With oracle something like the following is logged after the SQL statement that caused the problem:
(ORA-04031: unable to allocate 68 bytes of shared memory ("shared pool","SCHEMEPERMISSIONS","sql area","optdef : apanlg")

It might be possible to increase the resources available to the database to ensure that these SQL queries complete.

The true solution is to retrieve issues in batches if a large number of has to be retrieved.
fields.summary: Large select queries for subscriptions.

fields.description:
When trying to add a user with a #sign in their username to a group, the group is added to the user, but the administration screens are broken after doing so. Here are steps to reproduce:

- Click Administration
- Expand Users & Groups
- Click User Browser
- Type "testuser" in Email Contains
	- system will return username = #testuser
- Click on #testuser link
- Click Edit Groups
- Select group and click Join
 
Expected result: new group is added to that user's list and the group edit screen is returned for further management.

Observed result: 
	Under Available Groups = "User is a member of all groups."
	Under Groups = "User isn't a member of any groups."

The "<<return to viewing user" link has '' for the username and points to this url (domain has been changed username was not removed by me):
https://host.mydomain.net/jira/secure/admin/user/ViewUser.jspa?name=
fields.summary: username with # breaks group editor

fields.description: This  causes huge perfromance problems on reindex or import and potentially other places.
